content: b p13 color b k2tog k1 ssk 3 sts color a p7 color a k1 k2tog 2 sts 16 color a ssk k5 6 sts 25 color a slip 1 p1 color b k2tog k9 ssk 11 sts color b p3 color a k5 k2tog 6 sts color a p2 17 color a slip 1 p5 26 color a slip 1 k6 7 sts color b p11 color a p6 only one strand of color a will be used from row 26 on cut the unused ball of color a the one you didn t use for row 26 and color b arrange the 7 live sts onto 3 dpns join in the round and k all sts for 13 rounds cut yarn and thread through live sts pull closed and weave in loose end 4 your work at this point will look like this pic 2 use the co tails and a darning needle to align the top edge making it appear straighter and without gaps between the colors pic 3 2 3 with one hand hold the edges together along the back of your songbird and seam closed pic 4 the tail should remain unstuffed and be flattened pic 5 do not leave it in a tubular shape 4 5 the body of your songbird can be stuffed now or later after the head is knitted either way is fine 5 top of head with color a and 2 dpns pu 14 sts in original color a co sts 7 on each side of the seam pic 6 then work the row below back and forth as with the body slip the first st of each row purl-wise on the p side and knit-wise on the k side after a few row all sts can be arranged onto a single dpn for easier knitting pic 7 6 7 1 slip 1 p13 2 slip 1 k13 3 slip 1 p13 on the following row 2 sts will be wrapped 3 times each this will shape the head and change the direction of your work follow the instructions for row 4 exactly as written 4 slip 1 k11 wt p10 wt k10 wt p10 wt k10 wt p10 wt k12 5 slip 1 p13 6 ssk 2x k6 k2tog 2x 10 sts 7 slip 1 p9 8 ssk 2x k2 k2tog 2x 6 sts 9 slip 1 p5 10 ssk k2 k2tog 4 sts 11 slip 1 p3 12 ssk k2tog 2 sts 13 p2tog 1 st cut yarn thread through remaining st weave in loose end on p side 6 bottom of head with color b and 1 dpn pu 7 sts in original color b co sts pic 8 leave a tail of 8 -10 inches for seaming the top of head to the bottom later then work the row below back and forth slipping the first st of each row as before 8 9 1 slip 1 p6 6 ssk k1 k2tog 3 sts 2 slip
